cobblemon.species.favismet.name: Favismet
cobblemon.species.favismet.desc1: Seemlingly made of ribbons, it is said that this Pokémon is only held together by the fact that it was preordained to be so.
cobblemon.species.favismet.desc2: The legendary Pokémon of Provedence. Its only other known sighting has been over the Hexon region when disaster struck.
cobblemon.species.roaroot.name: Roaroot
cobblemon.species.roaroot.desc1: The bitter smell of this Pokémon is too strong for most to bear, warding off would be predators.
cobblemon.species.roaroot.desc2: A Pokémon only known to be native to the Hexon region. Reasons why are unknown, as it evolves into Carnivine.
cobblemon.species.hydraangea.name: Hydra'angea
cobblemon.species.hydraangea.desc1: Its alluring smell has only gotten sweeter since it evolved, luring in prey much bigger than just bugs.
cobblemon.species.hydraangea.desc2: Unlike its predecessor, Hydra'angea is rooted into the ground. This makes finding prey far more difficult.
cobblemon.species.sharqueous.name: Sharqueous
cobblemon.species.sharqueous.desc1: Some say this Pokémon and Sharpedo have a common ancestor. Whatever the case, its rage is unlike any other of its size.
cobblemon.species.sharqueous.desc2: It's said that this Pokémon's rage comes from the fact that it is left alone by its mother upon its birth.
cobblemon.species.submergine.name: Submergine
cobblemon.species.submergine.desc1: This Pokémon's speed is somehow not weighed down by its massive size and weight, cementing its place as one of the fastest sea-dwellers.
cobblemon.species.submergine.desc2: It can stop within the span of a second, even after barrelling through the ocean at its top speed.
cobblemon.species.underkill.name: Underkill
cobblemon.species.underkill.desc1: Its entire evolutionary purpose stems from its biological hatred towards Locous. In its eyes, it isn't just the king of the sea.
cobblemon.species.underkill.desc2: Previously found in some of the deepest parts of the ocean, this Pokémon can now be found circling the Hexon region's edges.
cobblemon.species.dodetrad.name: Dodetrad
cobblemon.species.dodetrad.desc1: After its middle head splits in two to evolve, the now Dodetrad spends its days getting into pointless squabbles with other flying-types.
cobblemon.species.dodetrad.desc2: Being previously undiscovered, Dodetrad has been living on the Hexon region for the past few years, blissfully ignorant of its rarity.
cobblemon.species.penumbranch.name: Penumbranch
cobblemon.species.penumbranch.desc1: Its shell has been replaced by an obsidian casing which leaks its components. This allows it to use both pressurized liquids.
cobblemon.species.penumbranch.desc2: Some say that the heat inside Penumbranch's casing is hotter than that of a dwarf star. This is unconfirmed, as it is thought to be impenetrable.
cobblemon.species.chunlong.name: Chūnlong
cobblemon.species.chunlong.desc1: Previously a frail insect, Chūnlong has taken on the traits of its disguise. This lends it a sturdier exterior and a ferocious temperament.
cobblemon.species.chunlong.desc2: This Pokémon flies over the Hexon region, breathing in the fresh air that it has earned through its perseverance.
cobblemon.species.salaberrant.name: Salaberrant
cobblemon.species.salaberrant.desc1: After being exiled from their herd, male Salandit that survive with enough force of will can evolve into Salaberrant.
cobblemon.species.salaberrant.desc2: Oftentimes, trainers will find commanding Salaberrant difficult, as it lives solely for its own benefit.
cobblemon.species.victreebel-hexon.desc1: The environment of the Hexon region's Dark Hex has had a dramatic effect on the invasive Victreebel.
cobblemon.species.victreebel-hexon.desc2: The seeds of Hexonian Victreebel are so potent, any passerby that even catches a small whiff of them will begin to hallucinate.
cobblemon.move.slagray.desc: The user blasts the target with a beam of embers, using the Attack stat of the user. This also lowers the target's Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.bottomlessbellow.desc: The user lets out a roar from all of its mouths, hitting the target three times. The next time the move is used after it knocks out a target, it hits an additional time.
cobblemon.ability.crownjewels.desc: Inflicts a status condition based on the held type gem when the opponent's stats are lowered. This consumes the gem.
cobblemon.ability.dormant.desc: Contact with the Pokémon lowers its Defense but boosts its Sp. Atk and Speed stats.
cobblemon.ability.serpentsynergy.desc: Sound-based moves become Grass-type moves and are boosted.
